message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about Chinese Named Entity Recognition (NER) using a novel fragment-based model augmented with a lexicon-based memory. The paper combines character-level and word-level features to generate better feature representations for possible name candidates. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category of Computer Science, which is cs.CL. Additionally, the paper uses position-dependent features, which are a form of distributed representation, and this suggests that the paper could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (AI) sub-category, which is cs.AI. The paper also uses machine learning techniques to classify entity names into pre-defined categories, which suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (LG) sub-category, which is cs.LG. The paper also uses a lexicon-based memory to deal with the problem of out-of-vocabulary words, which suggests that it could belong to the Information Retrieval (IR) sub-category, which is cs.IR. Finally, the paper is specifically focused on Named Entity Recognition (NER), which suggests that it could belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category, which is cs.NE.
